title: Qutub Minar
description: A minaret and a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Delhi, India, known for its intricate carvings and towering height.

title: Red Fort
description: A historic fortification in the city of Delhi, India, known for its massive red sandstone walls and Mughal architecture.

title: Taj Mahal
description: A white marble mausoleum located in Agra, India, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

title: Jaipur City Palace
description: A royal residence in the city of Jaipur, Rajasthan, India, featuring a blend of Rajput and Mughal architectural styles.

title: Gateway of India
description: An iconic monument located in Mumbai, India, built to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary to India.

title: Hampi
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site in Karnataka, India, known for its ancient temples, ruins, and stunning landscapes.
